Druids and faeries

Druids - a powerful, but fairly well balanced class for the existing 
game. 
Three things I THINK need to be addressed before creating new spells 
is that you can get killed with protection on and the protection 
stays on your corpse (which is fairly useless). And reveal is useless 
in a fast paced level where taking a look at the TINY minimap to find 
invisible guys is a total waste of time. Reveal should dispell all 
invisiblity spells in the surrounding area and reveal the stuff on 
the minimap. Faerie spell is good, but the faerie you summon never 
get better than level one, which is useless when fighting high level 
guys that can kill them twice as fast as you can produce them. The 
faeries should gradually get better as the druid level increases.

Summon Golem - Druids were masters of the land, as there ultimate 
spell they should be able to summon golems

BTW- The trees over crowding the level only becomes a problem when 
the druid gets past about lvl 20. Then the trees are really strong.

Faeries- Does little to no damage, now that it cant fly through walls 
they are fairly useless to actually BUY
<To actually play they need some high damage spells.>
I also think the "carry" spell that someone suggested earlier would 
be a good idea.

Faerie Fire - A bolt of fire that does damage to the enemy over time 
(like a posion)

Slime - A spell that change the enemy it hit to a slime (keeps the 
same stats) for a limited time


Triknight
